Package com.xebisco.yield.physics

Class TriangleCollider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xebisco.yield.ComponentBehavior
      • com.xebisco.yield.physics.Collider
        • com.xebisco.yield.physics.TriangleCollider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Behavior, DefaultAxis, Disposable, Renderable
    public class TriangleCollider
extends Collider
    The TriangleCollider class represents a triangle shape for collision detection, with adjustable vertices and centroid.

    • Method Detail

      • getShape

        public org.jbox2d.collision.shapes.Shape getShape()
        Description copied from class: Collider
        This function returns a Shape object and is declared as abstract. This shape will be used in PhysicsBodies when creating its bodies fixtures in Box2D.
        Specified by:
        getShape in class Collider
        Returns:
        An abstract Shape object is being returned.

      • getVertices

        public Vector2D[] getVertices()
        The function returns an array of Vector2D objects representing the vertices.
        Returns:
        An array of Vector2D objects named "vertices" is being returned.

      • getCentroid

        public Vector2D getCentroid()
        The function returns the centroid of the triangle collider.
        Returns:
        A Vector2D object representing the centroid.

      • setCentroid

        public void setCentroid​(Vector2D centroid)
        This function sets the centroid of the triangle collider.
        Parameters:
        centroid - The parameter "centroid" is a Vector2D object representing the centroid of the triangle collider. The method "setCentroid" sets the value of the centroid for the current object to the value passed as the parameter.
